verses.verse: Hear <WH8085> you this, <WH2063> O priests; <WH3548> and listen, <WH7181> you house <WH1004> of Israel; <WH3478> and give you ear, <WH238> O house <WH1004> of the king; <WH4428> for judgment <WH4941> is toward you, because <WH3588> you have been <WH1961> a snare <WH6341> on Mizpah, <WH4709> and a net <WH7568> spread <WH6566> on Tabor. <WH8396>
And the rebels <WH7846> are profound <WH6009> to make slaughter, <WH7819> though I have been a rebuker <WH4148> of them all. <WH3605>
I know <WH3045> Ephraim, <WH669> and Israel <WH3478> is not hid <WH3582> from me: for now, O Ephraim, <WH669> you commit <WH2181> prostitution, <WH2181> and Israel <WH3478> is defiled. <WH2930>

They will not frame <WH5414> their doings <WH4611> to turn <WH7725> to their God: <WH430> for the spirit <WH7307> of prostitutions <WH2183> is in the middle <WH7130> of them, and they have not known <WH3045> the LORD. <WH3068>

And the pride <WH1347> of Israel <WH3478> does testify <WH6030> to his face: <WH6440> therefore shall Israel <WH3478> and Ephraim <WH669> fall <WH3782> in their iniquity: <WH5771> Judah <WH3063> also <WH1571> shall fall <WH3782> with them.
They shall go <WH3212> with their flocks <WH6629> and with their herds <WH1241> to seek <WH1245> the LORD; <WH3068> but they shall not find <WH4672> him; he has withdrawn <WH2502> himself from them.

They have dealt treacherously <WH898> against the LORD: <WH3068> for they have begotten <WH3205> strange <WH2114> children: <WH1121> now <WH6258> shall a month <WH2320> devour <WH398> them with their portions. <WH2506>
Blow <WH8628> you the cornet <WH7782> in Gibeah, <WH1390> and the trumpet <WH2689> in Ramah: <WH7414> cry <WH7321> aloud <WH7321> at Bethaven, <WH1007> after <WH310> you, O Benjamin. <WH1144>
Ephraim <WH669> shall be desolate <WH8047> in the day <WH3117> of rebuke: <WH8433> among the tribes <WH7626> of Israel <WH3478> have I made known <WH3045> that which shall surely <WH539> be.
The princes <WH8269> of Judah <WH3063> were like them that remove <WH5253> the bound: <WH1366> therefore I will pour <WH8210> out my wrath <WH5678> on them like water. <WH4325>
Ephraim <WH669> is oppressed <WH6231> and broken <WH7533> in judgment, <WH4941> because <WH3588> he willingly <WH2974> walked <WH1980> after <WH310> the commandment. <WH6673>
Therefore will I be to Ephraim <WH669> as a moth, <WH6211> and to the house <WH1004> of Judah <WH3063> as rottenness. <WH7538>

When Ephraim <WH669> saw <WH7200> his sickness, <WH2483> and Judah <WH3063> saw his wound, <WH4205> then went <WH3212> Ephraim <WH669> to the Assyrian, <WH804> and sent <WH7971> to king <WH4428> Jareb: <WH3377> yet could <WH3201> he not heal <WH7495> you, nor <WH3808> cure <WH1455> you of your wound. <WH4205>

For I will be to Ephraim <WH669> as a lion, <WH7826> and as a young <WH3715> lion <WH3715> to the house <WH1004> of Judah: <WH3063> I, even I, will tear <WH2963> and go <WH3212> away; I will take <WH5375> away, and none <WH369> shall rescue <WH5337> him.

I will go <WH3212> and return <WH7725> to my place, <WH4725> till <WH5704> they acknowledge their offense, <WH816> and seek <WH1245> my face: <WH6440> in their affliction <WH6862> they will seek <WH7836> me early. <WH7836>
